body_html:
I understand :) The problem is that tf.set_random_seed do not affect "randomness". In numpy we have another behavior.

tf.set_random_seed(2017)
z1 = sess.run(outputs, feed_dict={inputs: x})

tf.set_random_seed(2017)
z2 = sess.run(outputs, feed_dict={inputs: x})

So, it looks like a bug :)

I understand :) The problem is that tf.set_random_seed do not affect "randomness". In numpy we have another behavior.
tf.set_random_seed(2017)

tf.set_random_seed(2017)
z2 = sess.run(outputs, feed_dict={inputs: x})

So, it looks like a bug :)
body:
I understand :) The problem is that tf.set_random_seed do not affect "randomness". In numpy we have another behavior.

    tf.set_random_seed(2017)
    z1 = sess.run(outputs, feed_dict={inputs: x})
    
    tf.set_random_seed(2017)
    z2 = sess.run(outputs, feed_dict={inputs: x})

So, it looks like a bug :)
